summary: The Department of Energy's Office of Environmental Management is responsible for cleaning up nuclear waste from weapons production dating back to World War II. It estimates its remaining work will cost at least $407 billion. (The U.S. government's environmental liabilities are on our High Risk List .) However, frequent turnover among leadership at this office has slowed cleanup and made it harder to achieve its...
title: Nuclear Waste: DOE Needs Greater Leadership Stability and Commitment to Accomplish Cleanup Mission
